cells.data:
Set operations

Union $\cup$
Intersection $\cap$

$A$ and $B$ are disjoint if $A \cap B = \emptyset$

$|A \cup B| = |A| + |B| - |A \cap B|$

Difference of two sets
$A - B = \{ x : x \in A \land x \notin B \}$
This is also $A \setminus B$

Complement of a set
$\bar{A} = U - A = U \setminus A$
$x \in A \iff x \notin \bar{A}$

Theorem: $A \setminus B = A \cap \bar{B}$

Need to show both $A \setminus B \subseteq A \cap \bar{B}$ and $A \cap \bar{B} \subseteq A \setminus B$
($C \subset D$, assume $x \in C$, implies $x \in D$)

Set identities
$\overline{A \cup B} \equiv \bar{A} \cap \bar{B}$
$\overline{A \cap B} \equiv \bar{A} \cup \bar{B}$
$\bar{\bar{A}} = A$
$A \cup B = B \cup A$
$A \cap (B \cup C) = (A \cap B) \cup (A \cap C)$
$A \cup (B \cap C) = (A \cup B) \cap (A \cup C)$
Associative $\checkmark$
$\bigcup\limits^n_{i=1} A_i = \{ x : \exists i : x \in A_i \}$
$\bigcap\limits^n_{i=1} A_i = \{ x : \forall i : x \in A_i \}$

Computer representation of a set
How to describe a a set of elements from $\{ 1, 2, \dots, 11 \}$
Is $1$ in subset? $T,F$
&c.
$11$ bit string

Number of subsets of set $S$ is $|P(S)| = 2^{|S|}$

Functions
$f : A \to B$
exactly one element of $B$ is assigned to each element of $A$
$f(a \in A) = b \in B$
$A$ is the domain
$b$ is the image of $a$
$B$ is the codomain
range is $\{ b : \exists a : f(a) = b \}$
